instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.D6990: What is D6990? Diode sitting between PPBUS_G3H/PP18V5 charger voltage and PP3V42_G3H power supply input, can die and cause PP3V42_G3H to be missing and have no input voltage. .

threads.title: 82-3115-b
threads.message:
board has no liquid damage.  one cap (<CAPACITOR>C4705</CAPACITOR>) burned up and pad was missing.  ran a trace to fix the connection.  I get green light. but it flickers.  I also notice that <CHIP>U1800</CHIP> is getting pretty warm.  is the cpu/mxu dead?

pp3v42 -3.47v
ppbus - 1.7

is this a usual problem for this board or should i just inject voltage and see what happens?

threads.title: 82-3115-b
threads.message: Resistance to ground on PPBUS? If the PCH is getting hot, thatâ€™s usually not good if PPBUS is shorted

threads.title: 82-3115-b
threads.message: i measured on <DIODE>D6990</DIODE> pin 1 and was 15.2 ohms

threads.title: 82-3115-b
threads.message: That is definitely a short. Remove F7140 and see if pin 1 or 2 measures low resistance. If pin 2, inject 1 volt at first. If the PCH gets hot, this is fucked.

threads.title: 82-3115-b
threads.message: i may be wrong but i checked boardview and schematic pdf and couldn't find F7140

threads.title: 82-3115-b
threads.message: removed f7040.  pin 2 is shorted to ground. 11.8 ohms. i put 1v and 1amp on it and the pch does not even get warm.  tried up to 3v 1 amp and nothing is getting warm.  tried the alcohol test.

threads.title: 82-3115-b
threads.message: If the PCH is not getting hot, you are going to be ok more than likely. Put 5 volts at 4 amps and see what gets hot.

threads.title: 82-3115-b
threads.message: If PPBUS is at 1.47V and the PCH is getting warm then it is pretty much certainly dead.
